ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: When I am active, I enjoy it to I hate it
Notes: 1= I enjoy it; 7 = I hate it

ElementDescription: When I am active, I feel bored to I feel interested
Notes: 1 = I feel bored; 7 = I feel interested

ElementDescription: When I am active, I dislike it to I like it
Notes: 1 = I dislike it; 7 = I like it

ElementDescription: When I am active, I find it pleasurable to I find it unpleasureable
Notes: 1 = I find it pleasurable; 7 = I find it unpleasurable

ElementDescription: When I am active, I am very absorbed in physical activity to I am not absorbed in physical activity
Notes: 1 = I am very absorbed in physical activity; 7 = I am not absorbed in physical activity

ElementDescription: When I am active, It is no fun at all to It is a lot of fun
Notes: 1 = It is no fun at all; 7 = It's a lot of fun

ElementDescription: When I am active, I find it energizing to I find it tiring
Notes: 1 = I find it energizing; 7 = I find it tiring

ElementDescription: When I am active, It makes me depressed to It makes me happy
Notes: 1 = It makes me depressed; 7 = It makes me happy

ElementDescription: When I am active, It is very pleasant to It is unpleasant
Notes: 1 = It's very pleasant; 7 = It's unpleasant

ElementDescription: When I am active, I feel good physically while doing it to I feel bad physically while doing it
Notes: 1 = I feel good physically while doing it; 7 = I feel bad physically while doing it

ElementDescription: When I am active, It is very invigorating to It is not at all invigorating
Notes: 1 = It's very invigorating; 7 = It's not at all invigorating

ElementDescription: When I am active, I am very frustrated by it to I am not at all frustrated by it
Notes: 1 = I am very frustrated by it; 7 = I am not at all frustrated by it

ElementDescription: When I am active, It is very gratifying to It is not at all gratifying
Notes: 1 = It's very gratifying; 7 = It's not at all gratifying

ElementDescription: When I am active, It is very exhilarating to It is not at all exhilarating
Notes: 1 = It's very exhilarating; 7 = It's not at all exhilarating

ElementDescription: When I am active, It is not at all stimulating to It is very stimulating
Notes: 1 = It is not at all stimulating; 7 = It's very stimulating

ElementDescription: When I am active, It gives me a strong sense of accomplishment to It does not give me any sense of accomplishment
Notes: 1 = It gives me a strong sense of accomplishment; 7 = It does not give me any sense of accomplishment

ElementDescription: When I am active, It is very refreshing to It is not at all refreshing
Notes: 1 = It's very refreshing; 7 = It's not at all refreshing

ElementDescription: When I am active, I feel as though I would rather be doing something else to I feel as though there is nothing else I would rather be doing
Notes: 1 = I feel as though I would rather be doing something else; 7 = I feel as though there is nothing else I would rather be doing

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
PACES Boredom physical activity factor
PACES Enjoyment physical activity factor
PACES total
During the past month, on how many days did you do vigorous physical activities like exercises, heavy lifting, digging, aerobics, or fast bicycling?
Notes: days per week

ElementDescription: Again, think only about those physical activities that you did for at least 10 minutes at a time. During the past month, on how many days did you do moderate physical exercises activities like exercises, carrying light loads, bicycling at a regular pace, or doubles tennis?
Notes: days per week

ElementDescription: During the past month, on how many days did you walk for at least 10 minutes at a time? This includes walking at work and at home, walking to travel from place to place, and any other walking that you did solely for recreation, sport, exercise or leisure.
Notes: days per week
